messages.subject: Re: other lists
messages.msgSnippet: ... up ... I m sorry! My keyboard was sending without me meaning for it to! Something I was hitting was sending letters off before I was ready. And I didn t
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, "Priss Adams <Priss1000@a...>"
<Priss1000@a...> wrote:
> --- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, kbcdlovejo@a... wrote:
>
> > Ours has VERY few posters (a SC inclusive list)---but it's HARDLY
> boring.
> > There's the resident NUT, who can rile the list up pretty quick---
> like she
> > did this week telling folks that they should join H$LDA. Sorry, I
> can't stay
> > quiet about THAT. I also won't stay quiet about all those
> unschoolers who use
> > curricula or unschool except for math and reading. I WON'T shut
up
> then! <G>
> > I myself got a little riled up about book-worship---and that went
> on for
> > DAYS! <G>
> >
> > ~Kelly

I'm sorry! My keyboard was sending without me meaning for it to!
Something I was hitting was sending letters off before I was ready.
And I didn't even have much to say. After all this, it should be
something profound! Instead, I was just going to say that Kelly keeps
the SC list from ever getting boring. Kelly and the resident nut both
do their parts.

Priss
who apologizes again for the multiple emails

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] other lists
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/24/2003 2:05:28 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Ours has VERY few posters (a SC inclusive list)---but it s HARDLY boring. There s the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/24/2003 2:05:28 PM Eastern Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

> I rarely mention unschooling. It's the most boring list in the world.

Ours has VERY few posters (a SC inclusive list)---but it's HARDLY boring.
There's the resident NUT, who can rile the list up pretty quick---like she
did this week telling folks that they should join H$LDA. Sorry, I can't stay
quiet about THAT. I also won't stay quiet about all those unschoolers who use
curricula or unschool except for math and reading. I WON'T shut up then! <G>
I myself got a little riled up about book-worship---and that went on for
DAYS! <G>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
